The Peninsula Bangkok Hotel.address: 333, Charoen Nakhon Road Khlong Ton Sai, Khlong San, Bangkok 10600 Thailand

1.review_text: We had a staycation and everything was perfect. There were also free lectures on wellness from well known coaches and instructors. It was a nice surprise to the weekend. The food at both the River Cafe and at the Thiptara was fantastic. I especially would like to thank Ms Marjoe, Ms Apple, and the staff at the Thiptara for a beautiful and delightful evening; Sitthichai B, Rallayanee, Theerarat and Chef Bobby!

2.review_text: This is our 10 th stay at this Peninsula hotel. Excellent service, food, staff, accommodation, spa, gym, and pool. Highly recommend this hotel in every aspect without exception. Peninsula Hotels are excellent ! The Spa is sublime at night- lighting and services superb. You cannot go wrong booking here. Janet

3.review_text: It was a great experience staying at this ultra luxury hotel in Bangkok. My staycation here was perfect since I arrived and checked in with the Japanese guy and Maggi until I checked out. I do really love the room and view, bathroom is amazing decoration, lighting and marble. Breakfast was so damn good with all you can eat a la carte order menus. Thiptara thai restaurant is also nice for dinner :p

4.review_text: I never tried Peninsula Bangkok in the past, in part because many big hotel chains in Bangkok often offer generous benefits to elite members of loyalty programs consequently Peninsula is possibly not the best fit for me.  However for a change in scenery I tried it for the first time to broaden my horizons.  My stay was pretty much in line with my expectations: the strength of the hotel is polished service, the upgrade was slim to none as I am not a repeat guest, and the hardware is aging but still in decent condition.    I booked the entry level room and at check-in I was told we received an upgrade to a deluxe room but it seems from the website that the deluxe rooms are the entry level rooms.  The size was acceptable for luxury standards at 45 sqm and I felt all areas were relatively spacious and evenly distributed.  The river views were great as can be expected when booking a room in a riverside hotel.  It is very clear that Peninsula used to be top notch luxury and well ahead of its time several years ago because many features are still aligned to what many newer hotels have today, for example electric controls for blinds and curtains, bed side electronic controls for “do not disturb”, air conditioning, lights, etc.  There was even a TV in the bathtub which was probably quite rare when the hotel opened more than 20 years ago.  Some equipment was from a bygone era for example the printer / scanner / fax machine in the room – I do not recall ever having a fax machine with my own fax number in the room which could have been quite useful for business travelers many years ago.  Even though the hotel is not the most recent, I found the furniture to be in good condition, not many scratches, overall very modest wear & tear, and almost no stains on the carpet or sofa.  The shower also had great water pressure.  Bathroom amenities were Oscar de la Renta from Gilchrist & Soames which had a very nice scent.  The mini-bar and snacks were complimentary except for alcoholic drinks.    Breakfast was not a highlight of the stay but if my stay had not been during the busy weekends I might have had a different experience.  It was entirely buffet-style and there was no a la carte menu, not even a small one so that was lacking to qualify for luxury standards.  Also guests were all going to the buffet without being provided with plastic gloves as a covid precaution like what some other hotels are currently doing.  That said the main problem was not the food but rather how crowded and hectic it was without enough staff.  It was not even clear where the entrance was; there were signs instructing guests to wait to be seated but no staff to actually lead people to a table.    My expectations for service were high and were generally met – I found service to be excellent and polished especially doormen in traditional uniform at the entrance which gave an immediate feeling of luxury upon entering.  There were other instances showing their service-oriented roots, for example when they saw I was pregnant they asked me if I wanted a special body contour pillow without us having to ask, and also asking me if I preferred in-room dining for breakfast due to the pregnancy which was a nice offer and in retrospect we should have accepted.  Nevertheless service was not perfect due to the situation in the restaurant as mentioned above.    Overall the hotel was ok although due to the age of the building I am not sure there was enough that stood out for me to be wowed.  In normal years where we want to renew elite status with hotel loyalty programs, we will probably not be overly interested in paying a premium to stay in the aging Peninsula considering the more generous benefits offered by hotel chains such as room upgrades and free breakfast at Waldorf Astoria, Park Hyatt, and St.Regis to name a few.  I am not against returning but of all hotels we have stayed in Bangkok I would probably consider Peninsula as average, some being better and some being worse.…

5.review_text: Booked two rooms for us 4 (Parents & 2 children), a King and a double for 4 nights. The King was upgraded to a vast suite on the 32nd floor at check-in (without asking) and the double was connected. The half-board rate including breakfast and dinner. Upon arrival, we were greeted warmly by Khun Henry who set the high standards from the start and remained vigilant to our needs throughout the stay without being intrusive. Thank you!  Breakfast is at River Café & Terrace while the dinner we have a choice of one of 3 venues, the River Café, Thiptara Thai Restaurant, or the Lobby restaurant. Elaborate chocolate amenity setup twice in the room. Our rate was for 1/2 board and the food was sublime! Rooms were clean and comfortable and everything was in good working condition. Our kids had a blast at the pool and the comped boat service which still in operation (unlike the nearby hotels) was very convenient to take us to Iconsiam or Sathorn Pier (Saphan Taksin).   Awesome stay and the highlight of our 2-months Thailand trip. The  service, the views, the food, the amenities were all great. Very charming and luxurious place throughout - highly recommended!…

6.review_text: We have a great stay here at Peninsula Bangkok. The room is clean and spacious with relaxing Chao Phraya river view.   Hotel offer a la carte buffet Breakfast during our stay, very tasty and good quality. You can enjoy riverside view and refreshing wind during breakfast is a plus.  Staff are well trained with great service mind and very helpful as you can expect from 5-star hotel.

7.review_text: We decided to book and stay at this one-of-a-kind hotel during their special promotion period. It is undoubtably appeared that even after over 20 years operation, the facilities in the hotel was not torn and worn at all. It is truly a star on the west side of Chaophraya river and barely join a fame of city of angels like Bangkok.  The level of overall service and guest recognition at The Peninsula Bangkok is amazingly unparalleled. We were greeted by name from the porters even as soon as we arrived at the lobby corridor, who were actively assisted us with luggage. We met Ms Tung, The Chief Concierge who helped us check-in very professionally as if we were their VIPs. She showed us to our room where we were told being upgraded to a Deluxe Balcony room. As soon as we entered our…

8.review_text: At The Peninsula Bangkok, this is my 1st time stay that so impressed for my staycation with my friend.  I would said that it is top-notch service hospitality. Urban Oasis Hotel along the Chao Phraya River. When you stay at hotel you will feel a time stop. That was a precious moment when looking over the stunning view of Chao Phraya River and the city.  My room is Deluxe Balcony Room that is elegant contemporary style with classic that. So Luxury thai style and comfort. The room is well equipped and well maintained. Functional control panel to control all the light, TV, curtain, Air Con etc.  Sumptuous marble bathroom with exclusive bath amenities. The balcony is the perfect spot for scenic panorama along the city and Chao Phraya River. View from the hotel is the perfect spot to…

9.review_text: Love the “resort” feel of this hotel, beautiful location by the river. We stayed in superior room and it was spacious. Although the room is a bit dated but it’s well equipped and well maintained. The service is also the best.  We stayed there twice, a week apart. Our second visit was not quite as good as the first one. The hotel was packed and their service level really dropped. No bell service, slow service, some missed details in housekeeping, not allow late check-out, etc. We still had a good stay, though not as memorable.  We had dinner at River Terrace Cafe and Thiptara. Thiptara offers homey Thai cuisine - nothing fancy but tasty and quality ingredient. For river terrace cafe, it was just so-so.  I recommend the aquafit class for a fun time. Advance reservation is…

10.review_text: We booked The Peninsula for a friend’s birthday last weekend and we had the loveliest of weekends! Located on the Chaophraya river, the setting is perfect. The hotel is top notch, but not pretentious, which definitely puts it above others for me. I could live in the hotel room! Spacious, great views and a wonderful bathroom! Staff were polite and helpful, without being overbearing. The pool staff were amazing and absolutely know how things work down there. They got us sunbeds together as a group of 4, even when the pool was busy and water was constant throughout the day. We ate at the Thai restaurant in the hotel, which was delicious and very reasonably priced. I had duck red curry and we shared spring rolls-both delicious. The manager came to speak to us during our meal and…

11.review_text: Husband and I stayed here as part of a promotion the hotel were doing, an absolute treat for the pair of us as we were also celebrating our 1st year wedding anniversary. The hotel is a little dated but it's part of it's charm and it's been kept in excellent quality.   We were fortunate enough to experience the incredible buffet breakfast and the afternoon tea in the lounge. All excellent!   The room was very clean and spacious, the staff had arranged a small surprise for my husband and I for our anniversary. Great hotel, a fantastic experience!

12.review_text: If you are looking for 5+ star luxury hotel with the best service hospitality in Bangkok. Yes, I definitely recommend The Peninsula Bangkok. This is my 1st time visit at this hotel and make me so impressed both service hospitality and details of the facilities in the hotel, amenities in the room and stunning view in every room. I love this classic style of the property. Not only the style of the property but also staff are very good informative and services.

13.review_text: We spent a two night weekend at this property. I had pre-arranged flower delivery as well as afternoon tea booking ahead of our arrival. Both worked well.  First of all, I was quite disappointed when I entered our room only to discover that instead of the confirmed King Bed, two single beds were standing there. Secondly, I appreciate the gesture of a biscuit (cannot really call it a cake) for my partner's birthday. However, I was specifically asked to confirm the date of her birthday. To then get it already sitting in the room on our arrival was quite awkward (one day ahead of her birthday). Maybe I was just expecting too much with something a little more meaningful on her actual birthday. One minus on the wow-list.  The room itself clearly showed its age (more on that front…

14.review_text: Lovely weekday stay for us. The room was super clean and nice preparation from house keeping and rooms team. Their staffs are extremely friendly and helpful, start from front desk who checked me in and Khun Ladawan at concierge made our stay delightful. We will definitely coming back here again.

15.review_text: If you’re looking for an excellent, soothing and relaxing Spa experience, The Peninsula Bangkok is the place for you, every detail was superb! After Spa, their afternoon tea set must try! The best I ever had! I can’t recommend more this hotel! World Clas!!  Thank you to Jed for making us feel home away from home:-)

16.review_text: This year I decided to book the room at The Peninsula Bangkok to celebrate my birthday. I was very impress for the service. Especially Madame Tung, Chief Concierge Nong Pup, Concierge. The service team at The Lobby for my memorable Afternoon Tea. Thank you very much and see you again.

17.review_text: Comfy, large, premium bed, scenic view for staycation. Long swimming pool with surf board exercise class. Breakfast is just alright even though there are many choices from Asian, American or India. Overall staffs are nice & attentive.

18.review_text: It is such a good time to stay at The Peninsula Bangkok which is one of the best Luxury Hotel in Bangkok. A warm welcome from Front Desk by K Weena, she is very professional. One thing that I would recommend the hotel is Social Distancing during Covid time. I found that the hotel miss this point especially at the Restaurant. Many clients queued at the buffet station to get their food by themselves. Other hotels will assign staff to provide the food or provide Gloves for the client if they have to touch the utensils.

19.review_text: Having read so many nice reviews about the hotel regarding the views, grounds, ambiance, rooms and staff, we booked a deluxe river view room for a one night stay. We were not disappointed. What impressed us most during our stay was the caring and proactive attitude of the staff when handling elderly guests. Offers of assistance were forthcoming even without asking when we were in the hotel premises. Staff are highly motivated and sincere in their actions in providing the best service to guests. Buffet dinner at the riverside cafe   was good but not up to our expectations regarding the spread and taste. But this was more than compensated with the excellent breakfast buffet which was outstanding with the food variety. The hotel is dated ( being the second 5 star hotel to be built…

20.review_text: My staycation very nice and perfect, front desk staff and all area that I was visited they are professional and nice services. Even my birthday has been through but when I came back I get a surprise that my room got a special amenity!!! Thank you for all staff to make my stay so nice and relax!

21.review_text: Stayed here for 2 nights and was impressed from attentiveness of staff - since the booking process, my emails were answered promptly on day of email, and calls were called back to follow up on reservations within same afternoon. Arrival-wise, from the drive into the hotel, security were courteous to direct my Uber/Grab to the lobby entrance, and proactive staff were at drop off area to help with bags and direct guests to check-in area, where efficient and friendly check-in staff were stationed. Staffs at pool, gym and restaurants were also cheerful and friendly.   One of the best service moments that strikes me greatly was when i was about to open the door to go into the building after visiting the pool, and i saw a staff from the restaurant (in chef attire, so probably a…

22.review_text: Room with river and Iconsiam building view, spacious, nice design, look clean, tv in bathroom, narrow door to bathroom room though. .  - Booking was embarrassing as when I called, she made mocking tone when I book my stay to celebrate a BD alone.  - Check in was no hazard but they need deposit which was not informed when booking. Hotel provide mask and hand gel travel size as well, good thinking.  - Printer was provided but need at least 4 visit from different people to make it work. Finally it work well.  - Room should have been cleaner as I sat on couch and got needle stick in my tight, no blood though. Staff was tentative, in-house nurse (for staff) was called to take needle out. They insisted on sending me to hospital for vaccine, so I did. Busy morning.   - Coffee machine,…

23.review_text: ความอลังการ และ ความเป็นเอกลักษณ์ที่ยากจะเรียนแบบ ลงตัวในทุกมิติ และ นำเสนอกรุงเทพมหานครและแม่น้ำเจ้าพระยา ได้สมบูรณ์แบบอีกโรงแรมหนึ่งขอยกให้  The Peninsula Bangkok! ✨✨  luxury hotel  ที่จะให้คุณประทับใจไม่มีวันลืม   คะแนนเอาไปเลย 10/10++    ชุดยูนิฟอร์มพนักงานทุกแผนกออกแบบได้ลงตัวที่สุดของงานโรงแรม🧑‍✈️  #Thepeninsulabkk #Bangkok

24.review_text: I just went to stay here on last weekend for 1 night because I live in Bangkok and I just wanted to know how good it is. There is complementary shuttle boat service from Sathorn Pier (Taksin Bridge) with Thai style. The room looks classic for me and I like how sofa soft and comfy. The Chaophraya river view is stunning that you could see from your room.

25.review_text: The Peninsula Bangkok is Located along Chaopraya River in the Heart of Bangkok.  Location: Near Bts Golden Line, Boat Shuttle from Bts Taksin Station and Near ICON Siam the very big mall ( Boat Shuttle and Tuk-Tuk service available)  Room: Grand Deluxe Suite number **04 with spectacular view of city of Bangkok and Chaopraya River, Room is spacious with living room, working area, walk-in closet, bathroom with his&her and bathtub with TV. Bedroom is very Cozy, Mattress is firming  Amenities: Oscar de la Renta bathroom amenities is quite good  My staycation with Anniversary Occasion then Hotel was surprised us with  Flower bouquet, Snack and Fruit plate and Card from GM. I am so very Appreciated.  Breakfast on the riverside with nice weather and lots of choices.  Swimming with cute…

26.review_text: My family with 2 young kids booked a Deluxe room for 1 night at the hotel after seeing their various attractive advertising on FB. We booked the package with dinner Seafood Buffet and told them that we had kids. With the Thai government’s subsidy, the price was less than four thousand Baht. This is probably our 10th stay at this hotel. We told them beforehand that we were going to arrive early around 10 AM. They confirmed the room availability. However, we only arrived at noon for a check-in. They said that the hotel occupancy on Friday is less than 50%. The room was of reasonable size with a large king-size bed, a tv, a study desk with a computer, and a sofa. The buffet dinner was great. They had Canadian lobster, salmon, grilled River prawns, cold crabs, noodles, desserts,…

27.review_text: Had a chance to stay here  Love the room and decoration. impressed with the food here. The presentation It looks delicious and it tasty. Breakfast line looks very good, impressive, well organized, each element looks outstanding.  Overall love the accommodation and food here.  Lovely staff and professional service.  There was a story about the refrigerator and informed the staff that it not cold, and he come to change and fixed immediately. Very good. But some function at gym like YouTube can not use at fitness informed staff.

28.review_text: Never changed even after 18 years since my last set of stays. Perfect from top to bottom; perfection to detail and a team of staff envid by most in the industry here. Will be back for sure without hesitation

29.review_text: I would say this hotel is a little bit old but so comfortable and homy. The room is so spacious and the most important one, all of the rooms are facing the river. So don't worry  because you will get the best view with the best service from one of 5 stars hotel in Bangkok.  When i stayed there i got a chance to try Dim Sum buffet with nice presentation and super delicious taste. Thanks to khun Tum the restaurant manager for his hospitality during my breakfast and lunch time.  You will also get an unforgettable experience crossing Chao Praya river with their beautiful shuttle boat. A short trip but quite make you feel like in the movie :)  I also got a chance to experience the new Peninsula Hotels regulation that allow all guest to have early check in 6AM and late check out up to…

30.review_text: We always love our stays at the Peninsula, as returning guests they make us feel so welcome. So what is it like post-Covid? They have the Thai Thiptara restaurant and the Riverside Cafe open both were excellent as usual. The breakfast lacked the wow without the full buffet open but it was more relaxing being served at the table. We enjoyed our dinner at the Thai Thiptara restaurant.  The room (we are upgraded to a corner suite - thank you!) was as great as always. The bathroom is always a delight. These suites are charming heritage style if you like super modern these are beginning to look a tad dated compared with the newer offerings along the river from The Capella etc But the Peninsula still has my heart! The Peninsula has the best part of the Chao Praya river. Our package…

31.review_text: My mother and I spent one night stay at the Peninsula Bangkok last week. Everything at the hotel was excellent. The front desk staff was very friendly and professional. This was the first step of our impressions. We had two meals at the hotel, dinner at the Lobby, our food was very good and many thanks to Khun Note for her excellent service. She took care of my mother very well. We recommended Lobster bun for breakfast at River Cafe and Terrace. Peninsula Spa was also very good.

32.review_text: i stayed one night at The Peninsula Bangkok , its old hotel with old furniture but clean, take longer than usual in check in and check out, nothing special about it but only the location is good next by the river  .

33.review_text: Peninsula is by far the nicest hotel I have ever visited.  The amenities are sensational, the rooms excellent, and the staff are courteous and very efficient.  I am English and my wife is Thai, and we were made to feel very welcome.  A luxurious stay without snobbery is what you will find at the Peninsula in Bangkok.

34.review_text: We were lucky to enjoy the Peninsula and Bangkok right before the world stood still. The service was top notch and the room comfortable. The pool area was very relaxing and the location next to the spectacular ICON Mall and on the river is hard to beat. While in one of the busiest cities in the world we felt tranquil and happy at the Peninsula. As soon as this madness is over we will be back.

35.review_text: Have stayed at this property multiple times.  Had to cancel this years trip but hope to get back in 2021.  In the days of COVID just wanted to add my review to anyone who can and is thinking about going to this hotel.  Do so, you wont be disappointed.    The rooms (while perhaps at this point a bit dated) are very well thought out and extremely comfortable.  The pool is the best, love spending the day out there.  The food is wonderful and the staff is always at their best.  Great airport transfer service.  A lovely hotel.

36.review_text: We stayed here for a couple of nights at the very beginning of the virus panic and found we were able to keep ourselves to ourselves without undue contact with others. Spending the whole day by the pool in a cabana made this very easy and eating outdoors is definitely the way to go. Very comfortable river view room with balcony helped a lot. Food choices are extensive and quality excellent with lovely and very helpful staff. This was our second stay in the last couple of years here and we would definitely stay again.

37.review_text: Most recently I came here for a function I was invited to, as well as a wedding. I did stay overnight a few times, and to say that was excellent would be a complete understatement. It is mind-boggling the way they pamper you! Lets start with the welcome. It’s incredibly well refined, if arriving by private car I would recommend valeting your car since you don’t need to get your parking card validated, check in is slightly frustrating since the actual check in area is very small. Combined with how much luggage people who would be willing to pay that price bracket bring, it’s a tight fit. But the receptionists are always very courteous and soft toned. The rooms are so well equipped and huge! I had room 911 which supposedly was a standard room, but was so well equipped! Every day…

38.review_text: A massive thank you to the Peninsula Bangkok for all they did to make my birthday so special. We didn't quite know how special it was going to be, given it was just ahead of the hotel's Covid-19 shutdown.   We love this hotel for the way the staff make our stay so enjoyable, the rooms, the  wellness activities and their fantastic Artist In Residence program.   As returning guests, we always feel incredibly welcomed. I love the style of the Peninsula. I call it understated elegance and one in which we relax immediately. You know you are in a special hotel, having an elegant stay without it being pretentious.  The upgrade suite room (thanks so much!) overlooking the Chao Praya river is always a delight. The room was full of extra special touches. The birthday cake, chocolates and…

39.review_text: I wish I could rate more than 5 stars. From the moment you walk in the service is exquisite. The staff is attentive but not overly so. The hotel is thoughtfully decorated with many nice touches. It all comes together for a wonderful experience.   We had a large room with a desk and couch. Daily fresh fruit and treats. Excellent lighting although I would have liked to control lamps individually. Control panel on both sides of the bed for drapes and lights. International outlets. 110/220 outlets. Multifunction printer, scanner, fax. Separate water closet. 2 separate sinks. Food m restaurants is very good. Exceptional breakfast buffet.  Incredible 3 section pool.

40.review_text: We were  out at 7 am. We returned at 2:30 and our room had not been serviced. We called, and it took them half an hour to come although they said someone would be right up.  The hotel is lovely and probably is the nicest hotel in Bangkok. The orchids and flowers are beautiful . The hotel is nicely maintained and is well decorated. The breakfast buffet is one of the nicest we have ever seen. It is very extensive.The Concierge staff does have some trouble with English communications. I had good luck with Oui.  The room was large, and we had a view across the river of downtown Bangkok.  We loved the boats that shuttled us across the river or up and down to locations that were close.  They are fast and efficient.  We would gladly stay at this hotel again.

41.review_text: While staying at the Peninsula Beijing a few years back, we asked their staff for some recommendations in Bangkok. Of course they recommended this place. It was a good decision as the Peninsula never disappoints. Very Spectacular and impeccable service. The room was cozy and spacious. The breakfast was excellent, but dinner did not live up to the Peninsula standards. Definitely recommend the boat service, daily exercise and yoga classes. You won’t regret it!

42.review_text: An outstanding hotel located directly at the Chao Phraya River providing great amenities,delicous food and a perfect customer service. The pool area is a real eye-catcher, try having a swim at dusk,  the spa is luxurious and provides a variety of superbe treatments.

43.review_text: Spent a few days here in December 2019 - it is WONDERFUL.  I am not usually a City person, but it was easy to love Bangkok when you stay someplace as nice as this.   The room overlooked the river and sunrise (a bit weird in that you could see into the room next door, so remembering curtains at night was a must).  The ferry service was so great and fun - because we were there during Christmas, Santa was on one of the ferries and it was always exciting when we were able to catch that one (yes, we are adults, but I guess kind of immature!)  The staff was top notch.  I felt like I did not deserve all of the attention that they offered.  Always greeted us with a smile, I realize they are being paid to do so but I never had that feeling, it always seemed genuine and warm.   Great…

44.review_text: We stayed here after a cruise for two nights the hotel is at the top end of service  the accommodation  is perfect being on the river makes in very handy for sightseeing  The staff is  well trained and helpful  Food at the restaurants is verified and first class Highly recommend this hotel when in Bangkok

45.review_text: I’ve been holidaying there several times and would recommend it - still. The hotel facilities are wonderful, the famous Peninsula service shines, well, at least occasionally. Alas, by the pool area they have hired pretty useless male service staff (suggestion to the management: maybe hiring more women professionals would help...?). Looking good in your uniform is really not enough, contrary to what the pool boys think. It seems, even the Peninsula struggles to find good service staff nowadays... Will choose a different Bangkok hotel next time!

46.review_text: We stayed here for 2 nights recently and really liked this hotel. The staff very very friendly and helpful, the shuttle boats to other parts of the river where very efficient and useful in allowing us to see most of the important parts of the city by boat rather than the pain of road travel . We stayed in a balcony room river facing which was a great place to watch the sun sent whilst drinking a beer - well worth the extra . The breakfasts were superb - great choice, very fresh with good service . All in all a great place to stay and one we would come back to next time we are in BKK

47.review_text: We decided to stay one night to get an idea for a future stay. Yes as with all the Peninsula hotels the standard is of the highest you will find. Friendly staff, location excellent walking distance to the Iconsiam Mall. On the riverfront with lots of riverboat service, their own unique ferries. The whole place is 100 per cent fantastic. This will be a future stay for us, nothing to fault the hotel or staff.

48.review_text: This was our first stay in Bangkok and we were recommended to use this hotel.  Overall it had good points but also some very poor lapses.  On arrival it was a Buddha holiday which means that no alcohol what so ever is served.   Despite many emails prior to arrival none of this was mentioned.  In fact the holiday extended through the weekend but alcohol was served again by Monday.  So sitting in a plush hotel for a special treat and not having a beer or a glass of wine was annoying.  Even when we checked in it was not advised.  When we asked the duty manager informed us that the mini bar in the room was the only option.  A very limited selection at exorbitant prices. Did I come all this way to sit in the room and have a drink??  The room itself was nice and the bathroom was…

49.review_text: This is our second stay at this hotel, the last time being in 2014.  The level of service is extraordinary.  You feel so coddled from the minute you enter the hotel, and through every interaction with staff.  The rooms are spectacularly maintained,  the views of the Chao Phraya river fabulous, and the food and drinks, particularly the buffet are amazing.  When lying by the pool, the staff regularly bring around iced water as well as 'free' treats, such as popsicles and guava juice.  I can't imagine staying anywhere else in Bangkok and would happily never leave the hotel!  Price to experience ratio cannot be beaten.  The spa is absolutely beautiful, and the changing rooms by the gym have a sauna, steam room and hot and cold jacuzzis...lovely.

50.review_text: This was our first visit to Bangkok and to The Peninsula. It did not disappoint. The team were friendly and super efficient. The restaurants were excellent and the setting perfect.  We enjoyed the pool with its comfortable beds and ultra clean toilets. The Spa team were super and it is a relaxing experience enjoying the treatments there.  Difficult to imagine how our stay here could have been better.

51.review_text: Even though this is my first stay at The Peninsula Bangkok, all their professional hosts made us feel like we were regular visitors. At every opportunity, the courteous and friendly staff made us feel welcome. A big shout to the breakfast and dinner team at Riverside Cafe and Terrace. Well done for your prompt service and smiles!  The hotel and its decoration look outdated but it is obvious that the property is very well maintained and polished. For us, spending a good amount of time in the room and using their facilities, most things were functional and we did not feel like anything was missing. Our room has a beautiful of the river. The pool is outstanding at this hotel. You can easily spend the majority of your day lounging there.  One thing though, the food and beverage…

52.review_text: Hotel location is incredible, is locted in the side of the river. You an order the boat trip sails on the peaceful river from hotel staff. Hotel pool is nice complex. Everything was perfect from super helpful staff, quality breakfast to spacious, clean and comfortable room.  It is definitely a 6 stars butler service! I'm willing to stay at this hotel again if I come to Bangkok one more.

53.review_text: The first time we visited Bangkok we stayed at the Mandarin across the river, it was nice but that’s all so we switched to this hotel and this has now become our home in the city. Before our most recent visit we did wonder if it had maintained its style after many years: it was no surprise that it had. We stayed on the 31st floor, a corner room which still gave us a wonderful river view. The breakfasts are world class, the choice is immense, everything is fresh and tasty. A complimentary boat takes you to the Iconsiam Mall...I promise you won’t believe your eyes when you see it for yourself...and the boat takes you back. We love this hotel and look forward to returning.

54.review_text: This is just a great place to be! We come here every year since the opening and the service is of a very high standard. The Peninsula knows how to spoil guests. It is an excellent hotel and the site just besides the river is the place to be.

55.review_text: One of the best hotels in town with an excellent service and best location directly on Chao Phraya river. Relax at the very nice pool with a cocktail. Enjoy an afternoon drink and relax at the restaurant by the lobby.

56.review_text: Although this hotel is on the other side of the river, a 1-minute enjoyable crossing on a private sampan is a big plus. A tall tower with all rooms facing the busy river and the commercial area of the city. Several restaurants offering Thai, Chinese and international fare. A great buffet offers outdoor seating by the river which makes for a very enjoyable occasion. Breakfast is one of the best ever encountered. The pool is narrow yet agreeable. Rooms may be starting to need an upgrade yet still are ample and comfortable. All in all, a very enjoyable stay and definitely recommended.

57.review_text: I travel the world and stay mostly in 5 stars hotel, that was my first stay in peninsula hotels and I was so surprised! Look like I never knew what means service and quality before! Everything was amazing! Beautiful room with a panoramic view on the bay was fully equipped with all necessary things for pleasure and work, even the printer was in the room! Good night service was very good, fresh tasty fruits served in the room every evening. Perfect professional staff, amazing dinner and spa experience, helpful concierge, everything just perfect. I will definitely choose Peninsula hotels chain for my next trips! Just beyond praise. Thank you for everything.

58.review_text: My wife and I are frequent visitors to Bangkok, most of the trips we stay in the Peninsula, sometimes we try a new hotel that Bangkok offers. The new hotel scene in Bangkok is just wonderful but we still count the Peninsula as our favourite.   Other than its location (yes, we actually prefer this side of the river) and its quirky but charming rooms, what makes the hotel our favourite is its people. Everyone who works there that we come across is what makes the hotel special. During our recent stay, we met manager Paul who went out of his way to make sure our stay wasn’t ruined due to an engineering problem in the room.  But here comes the sad news, the room we had this time has seen its best days. It has not been maintained to the standard of a luxury hotel, let alone the…

59.review_text: We spent the first part of our honeymoon in Bangkok at the Peninsula and it was a fantastic experience from start to finish.  The staff was incredibly welcoming and the service was that of a 5-star hotel.  The hotel location is located on the river which was perfect for us, however if you're looking for a downtown Bangkok experience you may want to find a different hotel.  They have a very efficient ferry service which transports guests across the river, very seamless process.  The room was gorgeous, overlooking the river.  The breakfast each morning was one of the best breakfast's I've ever had - they will also go above and beyond to ensure you're satisfied.  If I come back to Bangkok, I will definitely be staying here again.

60.review_text: Another brilliant overall experience from reception to bedding to location (new usp Icon Siam next doors) to fine dining and the most extensive breakfast in town. Thank you dear Khun Nan and Ms Rosie for your warm welcoming, and Khun Lhin and Jed for making this unforgettable experience happen.

61.review_text: Simple one of the best hotels ,if not the best in Bangkok.Luxury,service and attention to detail at the highest level food beyond criticism in all venues .Its riverside position is an added bonus when dining outside in the evening or taking a leisurely breakfast and watching the boats on the river.            What more could you ask for .

62.review_text: We recently spent two night at The Peninsula and wish it could have been more!  We were upgraded on arrival to a magnificent suite with stunning views over the river. The breakfast buffet was outstanding and the level of service from all staff was impeccable.  We cannot recommend this hotel highly enough.

63.review_text: We had a deluxe room on the 16th floor. With 3 large picture windows overlooking the chaophraya river. The room was immaculate. Deep plush pile carpets, a walk in dressing area and a huge bathroom. Everything down to the plush towels, trendy bathrobes and comfy slippers (which fit) was wonderful. The room was full of gadgetry including a panel which told you the outside temperature and humidity. The downside for us was the breakfast. There certainly seemed to be plenty of choice but none of the juices tasted ok. Cereals tasted strange, sort of burnt. They looked ok but didn’t deliver on taste. I can only drink decaf coffee and they had to make this specially. When it arrived it was a small teacup, only half full,which was barely lukewarm. I tried again the following day but it…

64.review_text: We were there for there nights. While the rooms and decor are not breath taking, they are still spacious, well- maintained and the staff good.The view to the river was fantastic  especially at night. Loved that they had their own boat shuttle which made it very easy to get to the night market.The breakfast buffet had a wide range of choices and you could chose between being seated inside or outside. The children enjoyed greatly the pool. We also dined at the River Cafe' and Terrace and although prices were not cheap, dinner was very good.

65.review_text: This is the 4th time we stayed at the Peninsula, the hotel is old, but well-maintained, service still good, especially housekeeping which they did a good job, restaurant service can be slow though. The hotel is get busier each time and there is always an event each night, it caused some convenience as sometimes the road will be blocked depending the size of the event, usually the event finished around 11pm, before that can be noisy. The pool is always full 😅   We tried the spa this time and it is really good and clean, professional therapists, more expensive then the other hotel spas.  The buffet breakfast has a lot of food choices. The Chinese restaurant is excellent.  Hotel has boat service to/from the big + new shopping mall IconSiam, 5 minutes away, really good so we don’t…

66.review_text: We spent three nights in Bangkok and chose the Peninsula because of it s reputation.  Pro: - Nice room, classic furnishing - Superior concierge service - River view - Boat shuttle   Con: - Tiny Gym - Event sell out  - The Peninsula Lounge mystery   The first two nights were fantastic like you would expect when staying in 5+ Star.  However the last night turnend out as a disaster.  We returned to the Hotel after an amazing but also exhausting city trip and found the restaurant and the river side bar closed due to ongoing events. A third event (incl. Karaoke) was taking place on the lawn in front of the hotel.  As the staff has mentioned the Penisula Lounge on the other side of the river (the hotel offers a boat shuttle) we were still confident to spend a nice evenig in the…

67.review_text: The Peninsular Bangkok does the brand proud.  It is a first class luxury oasis in the bustling city of Bangkok.  Our room as ornate and comfortable with a great view over the river and the city skyline.  The service from all staff is outstanding.  We had dinner at Thiptara and breakfast at the River Cafe (both excellent - see separate reviews).  The hotel has its own shuttle boat which takes guests to/from the great new Icon Siam shopping/entertainment centre.

68.review_text: Great view over the river and northern parrot the city. Advanced service, nice employees and great breakfast buffet. The shuttle service with Peninsula boats is outstanding and great service. Stunning view from the top.

69.review_text: The Peninsula Bangkok lives up to every luxury standard expected with the brand: Flawless service in a subdued style, central location on the west side of the Chao Praya river for Bangkok skyline views (stunning day or night), carefully curated details throughout to provide modern comfort and an upscale experience at every turn against a traditional Thai pallet, and of course a renowned spa and pool. The property even offers Thai Cooking Classes for guests.  After a very warm welcome and seamless check-in process, thanks to our booking with American Express Fine Hotels and Resorts, we were treated to a lunch of traditional Pad Thai in The River Café and Terrace seated on a patio with a skyline view against the Chao Praya. For two lovers of Pad Thai, finally tasting the real…

70.review_text: The hotel is beautifully located along the river  - a big plus for us. What a pleasure to enjoy their extensive and wonderful breakfast (e.g., in addition to great Thai and Chinese options, don't miss the  sous vide Eggs Benedict with three sauces and three muffins to choose from - over the top good!) or having something  to drink in the late afternoon while sitting waterside.  We thoroughly enjoyed all three restaurants (Thai, Chinese and Asian/Western buffet), each superior in their own way.  And, the massage at their beautiful spa, a separate wing of its own, was seriously good.  Rooms are well-appointed and maintained with stunning river views (we had a room on the 24th floor); ours had a real foyer with dressing table and ample areas for storage. Public areas are lovely.…

71.review_text: The Peninsula Bangkok is ageing gracefully - classic decor that is clean and in good condition. Our room layout was a little odd - the room felt small but the bathroom was spacious. Water pressure in the shower was incredible.  Service, as expected for The Peninsula, was superb. Our personal highlight was the shuttle boat service - a convenient and relaxing way to travel to Icon Siam or across to the Mandarin Oriental. We told them it was our wedding anniversary and the hotel had a cake waiting for us in the room - that was nice. Bizarrely, despite booking a king bed, we were given two singles, set together closely. Its our 10th anniversary, not our 50th!  Amenities are pretty good. The pool, although narrow, allows sufficient privacy given it is split into three sections.…

72.review_text: Another wonderful b/fast experience.  Khun Sarocha (Zhu) is a standout member of staff.  Thank you Zhu.  Our breakfast is the most important meal of the day for us.  Ambiance, quality of service and food outstanding.

73.review_text: We stayed at the classic Peninsula Hotel for 4 nights in December. And i have to say for a hotel that was built ages ago they maintained a great level of service and quality.  The hotel is elegantly designed and has a spacious room with a view of the river.  Shuttle service to and from the neighbouring hotels, malls are always available( not sure how late they operate).   A couple of recommendations I have that is a must try are the Spa, Thai restaurant and breakfast buffet in the hotel.

74.review_text: Returning to the Peninsula after quite a few years I found it was still all the things I loved on past visits. The hotel sits riverside and the rooms and suites are arranged to take maximum advantage of the views up and down the busy river and the city beyond.  My suite had floor to ceiling windows in living and bedroom that offered captivating views.  It also featured a full sized mahogany desk with printer for needing working space, a large marble bath, and dressing area complete with pass thru box to leave shoes for overnight polishing and retrieving the morning paper. Tea and a few goodies were delivered every afternoon which was a nice touch.  I did not take advantage of the spa but did spend time at the riverside pool which had plenty of covered and uncovered lounges and a…

75.review_text: We returned to the Peninsula Hotel after 20 years to celebrate New Years Eve. What a colossal disappointment! We paid $700.00 for the worst meal of our lives and the worst service imaginable. It took them 4 hours to serve cold, inedible food. The worst meal of my life. Every request to speak to the chef went unheeded.. the fireworks were great  At 3:15 in am the doorbell rang. I called the desk and they said laughingly it was the staff they made a mistake. Really! Cherie

76.review_text: It was our second time staying at the Peninsula Bangkok, on this occasion, for four nights in mid-December. It is a breathtaking, well designed property with incredible views, amazing grounds and lush gardens. Our experience was beyond exceptional pre-arrival straight through to after departure. This is a superbly run property - both in terms of management and maintenance. Days before checking in, guest services emailed noting our return, inquiring on flight arrival and asking for room preferences. Check in was seamless, room available immediately, and room offered outstanding. Check out was efficient and easy.  Overall, service and the staff were top notch in every single way at every point of interaction - whether at the pool, on the boat, with concierge, or when dining at one…

77.review_text: My wife and I stayed at the Peninsula Bangkok just before Christmas, we booked through the Amex Fine Hotels and Resorts service. The service all around was fantastic! Upon check-in around 8:30am we were checked in directly in our suite which was a great surprise after a long haul flight. The highlight of the trip was the Concierge team, especially Oui, who arranged our airport transfers, and two tours. We did a floating market tour and a nightime tuk tuk food tour which was fantastic. The concierge team even left a post-tour custom surprise in our room which was incredibly thoughtful and highly personalized -- this was beyond personalized service than what I have experienced at another hotel. The hotel's boat shuttles across the river are super helpful to get into Silom quickly…

78.review_text: We expect much better from the Peninsula Hotel. First of all, the car which picked us up from the airport was way too small and we clarified that we had 8 guests staying yet they provided us with a van merely capable of taking 5 people. We needed up being extremely squashed with luggage’s on our laps. Terrible. Then when we go to the hotel, we asked for bottle openers and extra towels (fairly normal requests) and the housekeeper was extremely rude and gave us the worst attitude!! One night, I asked for a harder pillow and this same male housekeeper came after 1 hour and on top of that knocked the door so loud at 1am that my sleeping daughter woke up. How inconsiderate. Another housekeeper who came to set up an ironing board in our room even dropped my wife’s phone and shattered…

79.review_text: This is my first time writing a hotel review, but my experience at the hotel was utterly appalling.  My boyfriend and I came here to celebrate our New Years Crossing 2019, and spent extra  (over USD$600+ per night) to be staying at the Peninsula hotel to ensure we have a fabulous experience.  From the moment we arrived at the hotel, we experienced a series of disappointments due to poor hotel management. The concierge forgot to order our taxi, the mango pudding delivery came at a wrong time, the huge mix-up of our NYE dinner reservations, insufficient towels at the pool, made us feel that we definitely should have booked the Mandarin Oriental instead.  The shower design was poor, resulting puddles of water the following mornings after shower the previous night! Even the tub…

80.review_text: Our experience in The Terrace Suite at The Peninsula Bangkok with Butler Angel "Khun Ae Khamtum" surpassed all our expectations of excellence!  How we landed here was a bit by mistake.  We usually stay across the river at The Oriental but our Suite was not ready when we arrived - they were having delays with the renovation.  The alternative room they offered us was not to our liking.  We didn't want to leave the River so immediately looked into The Peninsula and booked a Terrace Suite.    When we arrived we were overwhelmed with the opulance and views of our suite. It was massive with a rooftop terrace sun-deck and jacuzzi. The suite and terrace offered unparalleled breathtaking views of the river and city.  But the overall highlight was the experience provided by our Butler…

81.review_text: Everything about the hotel was very relaxing and staff were very friendly and helpful.  We arrived mid morning via the hotel airport transfer which meant checkin was done directly in the room.  Rooms were spacious and it was possible to sit there all day and look at the views over Bangkok. Upon leaving the hotel was also able to allow a late check out until around 9pm as we had a late flight which was very helpful.

82.review_text: The hotel is a soaring tower along the Chao Phraya River in the heart of Bangkok. We stayed at Grand Deluxe rooms, with commending views of the city skyline and busting riverfront.  The rooms are well appointed with the latest Peninsula proprietary technology, but could use some new carpeting and wall paper to fresh up a bit. The hotel has a boat dock and it is really convenient for hotel guests to take the river cruise and visit the Grand Place. The hotel has a breathtaking three tiered palm and cabana flanked pool looking out over the river. After the swim in the pool, I had the best massage ever at the hotel spa. The spa occupies a 3-story Thai colonial style building close to the pool. I had 1.5 hour traditional Thai massage with another half an hour compressing. My masseuse…

83.review_text: A big 5 star hotel at Bangkok, location at on the Chao Phraya Riverside it's a good view good place and good weather and that sure is good service, Most users are foreigners family,a couple  Recommend evening And the viewpoint by the river You will find the evening lifestyle of the people of Bangkok on the golden river. Until not forgetting to take the camera to take memories

84.review_text: Stayed there for three night with a family of six. Everything was so pleasant and professional.  Breakfast selection and quality was one of the best we ever had. Staff is friendly and polite. A real pleasure.

85.review_text: We just spent 3 night at this excellent and wonderful hotel . Everything went smoothly from the time I booked directly with the hotel to the check in to the selection of the rooms . The rooms were Deluxe suite connecting with a twin bed room . It must have been one of the most luxury hotel we ever stay in ( It shared no 1 spot in our family list with another excellent hotel - Victoria Jungfrau in Interlaken Switzerland) . The staff including the management are the best that you will ever encountered . We were even got an invitation the cocktail hosted by the GM Joseph Sampermans . We had a wonderful experience with Peninsula Bangkok and will definitely stay there again . Also we will book with the Peninsula brand wherever possible such as our next trip to Tokyo - Peninsula Tokyo…

86.review_text: The hotel and staff were amazing from the moment we arrived until the moment we departed.  Their service is top notch and when a language barrier occurs, someone on the staff is quick to pop in and “make sure”. As food as a location as you could want as far as we can tell and the one bedroom suite is definitely worth it (just make sure the a/c is tuned up if it’s hot when you’re there....)  When our safe was accidentally left open we receive a note about it and they closed it- added a new code that only could be provided to me hen meeting with the Mgr of the entire hotel! Impressive! Well done to everyone at the Peninsula!!!!  They have their own dock on the other side of the river so getting back and forth is a breeze! Tell Captain “Mississippi” I said hello! They also have an…

87.review_text: I think this is our "new best" hotel that we've stayed in!  We were perched high above Bangkok on the 30th floor, in our incredible room overlooking the river.  Absolutely incredible!  It made Bangkok for us... we felt like we were in the city the whole time we were in the comfort of our own room.   We couldn't have asked for more in our room, two bathrooms, fantastic views, nice big bed. Even the TV was huge... the main one that is!  Nespresso machine, nice table for eating... anything you could want!  The staff is great, and so is the location.  They have their own boat that can ferry you across the river even!  We had a great breakfast and an even better dinner.  There's a Michellen star restaurant too.  We were able to enjoy the wonderful outdoor pool too, which our kids…

88.review_text: A recent weekend stay in Grand Deluxe room was truly an experience that I would remember for a lifetime. From the moment we were received at the airport till we stepped into the hotel, our entire stay till we checked-out and left the hotel, we were showered with royal treatment. I love everything in this hotel, the wide range of amenities available and fantastic personal 5-stars services provided, not to mention all the warm and friendly staffs that had made our stay in The Peninsula a very memorable one.   Our room had a wonderful river view and could see the hotel pier and shuttle boats too. Housekeeping was impeccable and in fact had gone for an extra mile by anticipating our needs and had them ready even before we asked. I especially like the big, fluffy and soft bath…

89.review_text: Usually stay at the Mandarin Oriental but due to refurbishment couldn’t get in.  Having tried the Shangrila earlier in the year we thought we would try the Peninsula for our 1 week visit. Overall it was a very good choice. The room was a little dated but perfectly well fitted out and very clean. Good River view.  Breakfast is on the riverfront which is lovely. Plenty of choice and quality decent. This also doubles up as a bar in the evening. Cocktails ok. We spent most of our days at the pool.  It’s a series of small pools in a long line.  You have to change beds throughout the day due to the shade created by the building.  Pool staff are excellent and on top of everything.  Very friendly people indeed. The one down side is the shocking music they play over the loudspeakers.…

90.review_text: 3D2N staying at Peninsula.  This time visit in December.  The weather is cool and warm sunshine.  From the pictures I share. You will see the details of Peninsula.  We r staying at room 1903 - though we do not have a balcony this time.  The 180 degree view is not bad. Facing the river and closely watch at ICONSiam. There is 8pm fountain show outside ICONSiam good for family visit.  My enjoyable ride is Peninsula Boat shuttle. Highly convenient access to BTS station, transit to ICONSIAM and Asiatique at the evening.   The other thing I like is Peninsula has a video to introduce other properties in the world.  I found the story and history is touching and demonstrate the family culture existed in the Organization.  Everyone from top-down and bottom-up has try their best to enhance…

91.review_text: 5 nights at this wonderful hotel, fantastic suite overlooking the river and incredible Buttler Khun Ae. I can not rave enough about the professionalism of K. Ae. His warm welcoming smile every morning and throughout the day, his attention to detail in his service is outstanding. The Peninsula hotel Bangkok is lucky to have him on their staff. In fact, all the staff at the hotel I meet was with a warm greeting from Spa ladies to the concierge and reception team. Khun Boeing, Asst. front desk manager was heartwarmingly kind and gracious throughout our stay. Enjoyed our conversation with K.Boeing at the manager cocktail party, while drinking superb mixers from top rated bartender Khun Golf.   I will miss Khun Ae, so I will be back soon.  Pic 1 is with K. Ae, my sister, Erika and I.…

92.review_text: What else is there to say?  The location if great, the hotel is sumptuous and the amenities are luxurious.  I wouldn't hesitate to stay here again.  The rooms are incredibly comfortable and well appointed.  I had a great corner room with a room towards the river and Iconsiam which is within walking distance.   There are multiple restaurants to choose from and food was excellent in the 3 that I tried.  Service is impeccable everywhere and the floral arrangements need to be seen to be believed.  This was my first experience with the Peninsula and based on this experience I would definitely book with them again.

93.review_text: Spent three nights at the Peninsula. One of the world's truly luxury and luxurious and indulgent hotels. We had a room with a balcony and just sublime at night watching the river cruise boats and other traffic moving up and down the river. A kaleidoscope of colours and cacophany of voices and music. The hotel is big and has three restaurants although you have to do the buffet at night at least once. Just superb.

94.review_text: We were there for three nights and it was wonderful. We paid to upgrade to a higher level room and so worth it. We were on the 24th floor with a balcony. The view was amazing especially at night. In fact, one night and we were entertained with fireworks! Our room was spacious with a small room with a closet, a place to put our luggage with drawers underneath and a table to put on make up! The bathroom was just as fabulous with two sinks!  The breakfast was delicious and so much to choose and even a good selection of gluten free items. There was even an area where they would make smoothies. Tea in the afternoon is first class and our server was very valuable helping us choose a tea. The service was fantastic. I had fallen while visiting one of the Temples and they brought up two…

95.review_text: The Peninsula was an Exquisite experience!! Truly a 5 star hotel.  The attention to detail at every level is amazing.  The breakfast buffet is not only delicious but caters to your every culinary desire....including gluten free options. The level of service is truly amazing.  We were traveling with friends a we all had the same delicious experiences.  We ended our 3 week trip in Southeast Asia staying at the Peninsula. Which is a good thing since nothing could have compare to the pampering we received while at the Peninsula.  During our trip we were in the villages and rice fields of Cambodia which was an absolute life changing experience.  For us to experience the full breath and depth of life is what makes living amazing.  Consider the possibility of treating yourself to the…

96.review_text: I did a lot of research to find the best hotel for us in Bangkok.  The Peninsula is perfect!  It was a difficult decision between the Mandarin Oriental and Peninsula.  We had a drink at the Mandarin and it did not seem superior to the Peninsula and the Peninsula’s room rate was significantly less.  The water taxis cross the river frequently which made getting around the city as easy as possible.  The staff were so accommodating, they even brought my favorite dish to our room upon arrival- mango sticky rice.  The room had gorgeous views!  The pool was lovely with plenty of shade.

97.review_text: As I write this review it is our last night of a five night stay. I will be sad to go and that should say enough about this hotel if you are trying to decide.  It is indeed a grand old dame of a property and it is very good if not perfect.  The Good 1. The position is great. On the river with river views from all the rooms. A short walk to the impressive Iconsiam mall which has something for everyone in the family. 2. The room is comfortable with all the little touches of a five star hotel from an era when five stars stood out from the crowd. All the amenities one would expect from a five star room. One touch I love is the “do not disturb/please make up room” combination light. 3. Housekeeping was phenomenal. The lady who did our room did the hotel proud. Whenever we left we lit…

98.review_text: Stayed for three days and should have extended for the weekend.  Breakfast, lunch and dinner were delicious!!!  Enjoyed the free boat ride too!  Service always with a smile and responsive.  Definitely going back but with the family this time!

99.review_text: My daughter and I stayed here for three days and three nights.  When I first walked into our room (1501), I felt like Kate Winslet in 'The Holiday' and my daughter was highly tickled by my reaction of disbelief.  The view of Bangkok on both sides of the river was astounding.  I could have sat at the picture window and photographed the ever-changing busy scene all day.  Aside from the luxury which I presume is expected of a hotel in this category, I greatly appreciated the helpfulness of all the staff and the thoughtful little gestures: for example, guests are provided with an 'on demand' trip across the river in the hotel's fleet of boats; but to be personally directed to the correct BTS entrance and to be given useful information about Chinatown by staff who are "off duty" and…

100.review_text: This is a fantastic hotel with really good rates at the right time of the year. The levels of service and luxury exceed most hotels in the world and as it is just across the river, it may put some people off. However a really frequent shuttle service across the river negates this and enables you to fully enjoy the city. All the rooms have river views and the level of service from the hotel is brilliant with nothing too much trouble. Our conference, comprising of 100 people, felt that they had been treated like nobility.

Chatrium Hotel Riverside Bangkok.address: 28 Charoenkrung Soi 70 Wat Phraya Krai, Bang Kho Laem, Bangkok 10120 Thailand

1.review_text: This is luxury a hotel right next to Chao Phraya River.  Great location with nearby restaurants, shopping, temples,...etc.  You have to get the room with the river view which will take your breath away.

2.review_text: We love this hotel. It is great for families and has all of the amenities, It is our go to staycation place. We highly recommend it. It is in a great location and the staff is fantastic. The food is affordable and the breakfast is great.

3.review_text: Thank you for special support for snacks / doft drinks / sweet and other in softy lobby chatrium hotel (near tanonjan road) by p’on ,for my friend’s wedding (king & mind) .if i have chance i’ll create my wedding at here.

4.review_text: That lobby , There are good mind service , when I visit here , I'm very appreciate to food and drink service , The food is so good. That locatio make me relax to vacation time , I hope next time I'll visit agian  #K'ORN

5.review_text: Great hotel  nice hotel good service  I would like to visit again and will recommend this hotel to my family and friend to visit this hotel  Reasonable price  Good location  And i recommend khun orn at lobby she have very good service

6.review_text: Very nice and luxurious hotel with good location and scenic view of Chaophraya River in Bangkok.  The room is very clean and comfortable with plenty of amenities and necessary equipment.  The hotel staff is very friendly with hospitality.

7.review_text: It was the best two nights get away. The facilities are great. Staffs nice and friendly. Awesome view! Large room! The swimming pool area is so big. Breakfast is perfect. The only thing I have a problem with was slow running water in the shower. But my holiday was great anyway! Thank you k. เกื้อกูล for birthday song and flowers. You and the teams are thoughtful minded!

8.review_text: Another enjoyable coffee  and cake at the lobby lounge! The team there are always polite, professional and smiley. Think it’s great the care they take to remember your name as it makes you feel really cared for. Thanks, will be back soon.

9.review_text: Mr. Wichai from concierge was very polite and helpful.  He assisted us in getting a taxi and filled us in on what to do in the area. His personality was great and I will return to Cahtrium because of the location and street walk.

10.review_text: Beautiful hotel, super courteous and friendly staff.  The room, a suite with a wonderful view, was huge, with a living room and kitchen, an exception to the breakfast, plentiful, there was everything and everything was of excellent quality.  I really feel like recommending this hotel.

11.review_text: We had a great stay in a 2 bedroom suite! Our two boys loved the pool and the breakfast buffet! The hotel water taxi was convenient and fun to use. Everyone was very friendly and welcoming. We would definitely stay here again!

12.review_text: Have a great time with friends at this hotel, very good taste at Dim Sum buffet, spacious room with breathtaking view.  Special thanks to K. Nat and K. Chai at concierge desk who always make sure that our stay is top notch.

13.review_text: Very warm welcome from Front office staffs and Chief Concierge the one with the golden key. Specia,Thanks to K.Nut Asst. Chief concierge provide one stop service offered the special package and make the room reservation for us.  After check in K.Fear (reception staff) escort to the room, explain hotel facility for us. The room super nice,river view  I will come back here again as soon as possible.

14.review_text: The Amazing and quality service provided by Khun Montana, Khun Chanida and Khun Noppadol is what make me call The Chatrium Hotel Riverside Bangkok home sweet home!  Being remembered from my previous visits, knowing the purpose of my visit and extended all assistance to make stay a pleasant experience will always make this hotel my favorite destination.  Thank you with love.

15.review_text: I really love to stay in this hotel. All staff is friendly. The room is clean. I couldn’t get up from the hotel bed because it’s very comfortable. Swimming pool with river view where not too crowded. Recommend to book the room with breakfast which is great. Special thanks to Mr. Supachai

16.review_text: My wife and I stayed at the CHATRIUM hotel with great happiness for different things. We were in room 2713 for half a month, this room represents all the quality of this hotel the Housekeeping service, efficient, helpful, always good mood. An exceptional view, pleasant and functional comfort. Felt like the home perfect time to stay here ... the hotel is clean all the staff is very friendly and very professional especially VARAPORN - the Guest service at reception and her team are amazing very helpful always greeting us with a smile. SUPANNEE and RAKSINA - efficient, calm, and on the lookout for all operations, restaurant waiter and their team have always impressed me and my wife by recognizing what we need, smiling, and providing very good service. We are very happy to vacation…

17.review_text: The room is nice and well cleaned. River view from 33th floor look pretty amazing at 5-6 pm. Hotel staff greets us with friendly faces and politely, always feels like home every time. Highly recommend!

18.review_text: great, friendly, polite, effective, beautiful. We suggest this accomodation for many families in adoption process!!! Pool is a good safe situation for a child, starting to play and know his/her parents

19.review_text: My second flight to Bangkok and I chose this hotel for a riverside location at an affordable cost.  Excellent from all points of view, convenient with the boat transfer, good restaurant, perfect breakfast. Beautiful room overlooking the river.  I'll be back

20.review_text: Stayed here this week following a purchase of attractive dim sum voucher package. Check in was a hassle-free feeling where I contacted hotel an hour prior via FB messenger telling I was about to arrive at 1.30pm. The hotel admin was quickly prompted in accepting my request and made sure my check-in was prepared. They explained even clearly in details that my room would be ready however an additional request I made at short notice might not be ready. There was no problem for me at all.  I arrived at the hotel by driving and this hotel provided a convenient car parking space where I just hopped from where I parked to the elevator which connected me right to the lobby reception. With luggage I had, I did not have any difficulty at all.  I was revived warmly at the reception by…

21.review_text: This is our first time visit and we will definitely come back.  They have such a friendly staff and ambience environment.  Quality service and spacious room is beyond expectation!  We have a river view room and both sun set and sun rise moment is breathtaking.  Welcome drink is great.  Thanks to Kuakul❤️

22.review_text: I spent 1 night in this hotel as the first time visit. It's a great and remarkable experience by Riverside. Hotel staff are all excellence in exceeding guest 's expectations.  Seafood at Pier is a best choice for an evening romantic dinner with a river view besides you.  I only recommend this hotel to all and Kudo to all Front Desk team.

23.review_text: The room is spacious, clean, has an open balcony to sit and watch the view, with a kitchen, a shuttle boat, have a chance, I will definitely return to use the service. Some sleeping nights dreamed of the joy of staying in this hotel.

24.review_text: This stay was the first time to face the new year 2021's  fireworks. We stayed in Two bedrooms suites which facing to Icon Siam and also hotel's fireworks. Suite is very clean, they prepared alcohol hand gel and face masks. This hotel is very concerned with cleanliness during COVID-19. Breakfast was very superb. Big Thanks to Khun Chatchawan GM who well organised since recommended Suite, booked, allocated until checked out. We promised that we will be back to our Bangkok second home again.

25.review_text: Last friday I stayed with my friends and i feel that the hotel is a excellent hotel i ever stay in Bangkok with a good services. Khun Varaporn and Khun Montana are a good staffs. They have a great service-minded! I am so happy to stay at Chatrium riverside hotel. I will back for sure!

26.review_text: I was stay for my family trip. It’s really nice experience to stay here. Very large room and well maintenance. Food was great with a good taste. The view is amazing, either day or night. Definitely coming back soon. Thx to K.Anak to arrange this wonderful memory to our family☺️

27.review_text: I highly recommend this hotel it has to be my most favorite in Bkk so far the rooms were large and clean, the bed comfortable and a great view of the river. The staff are absolutely amazing especially Khun Sudarat on the reception desk who escorted us to our room to make sure we were happy with the view of the river as we requested for my husband to do a time lapse and take photos and it was perfect. Even the staff in the restaurant were so attentive and apologized on one morning at breakfast due to being very busy so if you want an awesome hotel with the most helpful staff then this is the place to stay.

28.review_text: The Lobby Lounge at Chatrium River Hotel Bangkok becomes one of my favourite place to hang and kill the time. I really like this place because it has a good ambiance and not too crowded as well.   One thing that I got fascinated by this place, they had the most affordable and best services from the two staffs at the Lobby Lounge who really touched my heart. Her names Miss Onchira Mahapuranon and Miss Kanokwan Daengsi. They are highly capable. They know what they’re doing and what they’re talking about, and you can tell making the customers happy is their main priority.   The service was very good, and the variety of pastries and coffee served in the ambiance was very satisfying and so relaxing.  Ms.Maneerat W. Nov 29th,2020 Customer

29.review_text: Service and staff over serviced with out the sincere and warmth to raise to the  highest comfort level. The exception was the service provided in the outdoor dining area which was excellent. The beds did not reach the same comfort level as some of the other 4 plus riverside hotels stayed at. The room stayed at had no reference to Covid-19 safety as other hotels in the area, but maybe just an oversite with housekeeping. Mixed view from excellent to could be better in the mentioned areas. Just misses from exceptional rating.

30.review_text: All staff at lobby lounge are very kind and helpful. This is my first time at this hotel and it is very impressive. I will come back next time. KHUN APHISARA AND KHUN ORN ESPECIALLY LOVELY. Ani I'll come back for internationl buffet.

31.review_text: Very good service, friendly staff & house keeper did very good job in my room. Very clean & tidy. Specially thank you to K Anong. 🤗 make me have a wonderful & pleasant stay here. Recommended! Looking forward for the stay again.

32.review_text: Very nice hotel, very nice view, very nice staff, very nice food & services and accommodation so big:) If you want to find a hotel close to river view i recommend this. Its once of you choice to make you happy.

33.review_text: Hotel was beautIful, great service, great breakfast and very clean. All staff were well-trained. Special thank to Mr. Chatchawan for great services. We were reserved the room in high floor, 33rd so we could see the view of Chaopraya river very clear. Very nice and cozy atmosphere to relax. Great place with good price.

34.review_text: It was really pleasant stay in the quiet, colorful place nearby the Chaophraya River. We have stay with kids which enjoyed the pool and sweets from the Bar. Thai food in the River Barge Restaurant was really tasty. Buffet Dinner was reach with variety of seafood. Staff was really helpful and friendly. We were happy there!

35.review_text: The room is big and clean and has a fantastic view of the river. Staff were friendly. Afternoon tea session was impressive. Breakfast was good. Highly recommended for those who want to take a break and just rest.

36.review_text: There are very few hotels with balconies on the river at this price point with rooms this large. The rooms are generously appointed with full size refrigerator.  Bedding and furniture is very comfortable and the balconies for the suites offer a lot of space and comfort. The room  service menu is very large and the service is excellent. This by far is my favorite hotel in BKK.

37.review_text: Beautiful hotel and good view with Chaophaya river. Excellent service by K.Nat Concierge. Timsum buffet at Silver Wave is very delicious and many menu. Hotel location is located in town and near by many Departments store.

38.review_text: A hotel with beyond expectations Front staff name Amita and Wasin was extremely helpful. They know what I need and always serve it for. The room is huge then the price that you pay. Overall are 10/10.

39.review_text: The room is very big and beautiful with nice interior design. Not only the room, but I got very excellent services from professional staff, everyone is so helpful. So I really enjoy staying this hotel.

40.review_text: Chatrium Riverside was the first hotel that we made the decision to spend our vacation time after a relaxation of COVID-19 measures took place. We chose a Grand Suite Riverview that could sit in a balcony to savor the beautiful scenic Chao Phraya River in a panoramic view, take a deep breath, and enjoy the fresh air . The room is separated into 2 sections; bedroom and spacious living room. It also has a panty with a standard refrigerator size for home (not a hotel mini fridge size).  In overall, we are satisfied with the room facilities. However, we would like to suggest improving parking areas, it has unpleasant musty smell.

41.review_text: Chatrium riverside, great hotel, lovely services.   Chatrium riverside hotel, great hotel, lovely services. Hotel by the Chaophraya River, In the heart of Bangkok, Thailand. Excellent services by full service mind staffs. Thai style hospitality that made me feel like home. Nice view of the Chaophraya river bank on both city view and urban view. Highly recommended for couple, for business. Easy access to BTS sky train. Only few minutes to get into Bangkok downtown. Recommend visitors to try Chinese timsum buffet at lunch.  Seafood dinner is also good for money as well. Overall 5 stars hotel and services. Good choice when you visit Bangkok, Thailand.

42.review_text: This is one of the best in Bangkok by the Chaophraya river. Excellent services by well trained staffs. Nice facilities, very big room with very good amenities. Hotel is very near abs easy access to downtown. This is one of the best choice hotel by the Chaophraya river, Bangkok, Thailand.

43.review_text: The M family found themselves in this delightful luxury hotel for a weekend break. Situated on the (rather grubby) Chao Praya river, the hotel is what you expect a 5 star hotel to be (though, perhaps, not quite so luxurious as the Oriental et al.). The 60m rooms and bathrooms (and kitchenette) are excellent and all fittings are top quality. The staff are helpful, respectful and the majority are ladies, all stunningly beautiful. The breakfast is very good, catering for all ethnicities.  My family pigged out on an English, then vindaloos, then salami salad, with capers and fresh walnuts.  Assorted Thai dishes were obviously available too.  Sided with this was an assortment of fresh bread, washed down with strong, freshly brewed coffee. The infinity pool on the 6th. floor is what…

44.review_text: The room is big and spacious. The kitchen in the room is handy. The river view over the balcony is marvelous. The swimming pool is large and beautiful. Breakfast is delicious. The service is excellent. All the staff are very friendly and helpful.
