73.review_text: I was here last month. Time is not yet ao bad in thailand. Staff help me alot in everything. Transpo provided and good service by the supervisor king. Hipe i can comeback again. And also i wish thailand to be back in normal. I will visit this hotel again for sure.

74.review_text: I left a review in August 2019, I was due to travel to this hotel for 12 nights, sadly my father had a heart attack 2 days before I was due to travel, I asked the hotel if I could have a refund and re book or to just re book, was told NO, NOTHING, so I left a revire about this, One month later they replied on here to say sorry and to get in touch with them to help resolve this problem.  WELL THEY JUST IGNORED MY EMAILS  NO REPLIES AT ALL SO PLEASE JUST BE VERY AWARE ABOUT HOTELS LIKE THIS WHO JUST WANT YOUR MONEY AND ARE NOT BOTHERED ABOUT YOUR WELLBEING !!!!!!

75.review_text: Average hotel, apperently located directly on the red light District main street... The pool wete small. They did not make bed for three people Even thi they knew on forehand. But the cleaning was now and an okay hotel overall.

76.review_text: Hotel was good, spacious room and good for money value. Swimming pool is small, however staff is polite and friendly! They have free transportation (tuk-tuk) to nearby areas, such as mall and Nana Plaza area, where you can take train to city center of BKK!

77.review_text: Brilliant clean and spacious hotel. Away from all the noise about 15 mins walk to the main area but they provide a free drop off and pick up service. Always service with a smile special thank you to Nam and Fah. Will def be staying here again.

78.review_text: I would give 5 stars but the WiFi signal in the room was weak and the shuttle back to hotel was often not available. Overall its a good quality hotel about 10 mins walk from the main road. Room was spacious and comfortable. Staff were friendly and responsive. Breakfast was decent quality and the hotel was quiet at night.

79.review_text: The first night they gave Us a bedroom on the street and we literally cloud not sleep bevande of the noise and the traffico, but we asked to change bedroom and we really enjoyed it. The position is not great, it is about 12 mins to Nana bts station but they have free tuk tuk and Also the walking is not bed at all even if the area is not the best. The hotel is very nice, bedrooms are clean and large, the bathroom has a huge shower. There was no hot water in our bedroom but it was not a big problem since outside is warm. Breakfast is excellent, even with croissant! Pool is small but nice, Wifi works well. We would return

80.review_text: - Good breakfast but no kitchen/restaurant so room service not availabe. you have to go out for lunch dinner etc. - hotel is 1 kilometer from Nana BTS station, walking time 12-15 minutes. Hotel provides Tuktuk service frequent basis.

81.review_text: Hotel is a bit of a walk from the Main Street of Sukhumvit (but the hotel does offer a buggy service for free). The pool is small and on the ground floor so it’s only exposed to the sun for a limited time each day. Price was great though and the rooms were clean and tidy. One gripe is the water pressure and it hardly ever got hot too.

82.review_text: This Hotel is nothing more than, ok. We were promised early check-in when we arrived from the airport, but this was denied at arrival. Big minus. Staff is friendly at the start, but if they dont get any tips, they stop opening the main door for you.  Hotel is very close to a main street filled with people selling their bodies. The area is a no go for families. Price could be better. Standard is ok.

83.review_text: The hotel isn’t a 5 star hotel, but more than makes up for that with facilities and value. We stayed for 5 days in a deluxe suite room. I think, in retrospect, we were in the older building, but the room was very large and comfortable and had more than enough room to keep us comfortable. The fridge in the room was perfect for the plate of fruit they brought us every day, when we waived having our sheets changed. The breakfast buffet doesn’t have a large selection, but was more than enough to fuel us for our day. There was always western and Asian options for hot dishes and a great espresso machine. We appreciated being able to call for a pick up from the train station back to hotel. It’s a very doable walk, but in the heat and humidity, it was a welcome luxury some days. The TV…

84.review_text: Though this hotel is in the heart of Bangkok city, the location is a bit away from the main road which gives an option for a peaceful retreat. However, one block of the hotel is on the side of the express highway which became a nuisance for me, the sound of the speeding vehicles did not allow me to sleep well.  Hotel is well equipped with a small restaurant which provide a good buffet breakfast and also mid day lunch with limited options. The rooms are done well equipped with basic amenities like toiletries, kettle, tea and coffee making facility, hair dryer and a tv. They also provided 2 bottles of complimentary bottled water. The room also had a mini bar which was chargeable. The room was spacious and lighting was good.   The service at the reception was excellent, so was the…

85.review_text: 8 nights here,was a very clean place,great breakfast very helpful staff.namm and pang were amazing girls,helped us so much.all the staff are helpful.thankyou so much for our stay here.would stay again.

86.review_text: Was to travel to thus hotel on the 28th August 2019 for 12 nights I have paid for 12 nights but because of a serious incident at home I can not travel, I have contacted tghe hotel to be told NO REFUND, so they have took my money and they will book the room to another person so they will get DOUBLE the money for that rioom !!! VERY GREEDY PEOPLE AL HOTEL DISCUSTING WAY TO TREAT A PAYING CUSTOMER.

87.review_text: I stayed at this hotel 3 nights, the rooms are good and clean, the stuff were friendly but the location wasn’t very good, it’s at the end of the street and in a very narrow street actually and was a dead end road.

88.review_text: The Alt Hotel Nana has very friendly and attentive staff, and clean and comfortable rooms.  Also, they have a 24-hour massage service in which the masseuse comes directly to your room, which was a nice perk. The hotel is quite difficult to find, so my advice would be to call the hotel once you arrive in the neighborhood and they will pick you up in the hotel's tuk tuk.

89.review_text: Excellent hospitality.   Especially for breakfast and drop and pick up service from main road(battery vehicle operated)  Location is good.   Service is good.   Hospitality is good.  Comparitively room is cheaper.  Overall good service.

90.review_text: The hotel was nice. It was a bit of a walk from Nana station but at least it was quiet. You weren’t close to all the action. The staff were very nice and helpful. My room was awesome! It came with a bed, a couch and a TV. It also came with a balcony. All of this for a good price! Will definitely refer other people to it and I might stay back. Who knows...

91.review_text: This is one of the best choice when it comes to a luxurious and affordable stay in Bangkok near Nana Plaza. The hotel is clean, staffs are super polite, and the amenities are good. Also, being a guest friendly hotel makes Alt a popular choice among many solo travellers. I really enjoyed my stay there.

92.review_text: مواول مره اسكن بالفندق وفيه مبنى جديد يستاهل الواحد يحجز فيه غرف عاديه وديلوكس المبنى الثاني قديم الي فيه لاستقبال وبوقيه لافطار  للاسف المبنى القديم فيه الجونيور وغرف عاديه بعد بس انا ماعجبني حجزت فيه مره جونيور اثاث ماعجبني والتكيف حار والافطار مايستاهل انكم تحجزون اصناف قليله ولكن انا احب احجزه عشان المبنى الجديد وقريه من شارع العرب والمترو  الصور للمبنى الجديد   The hotel has been booked and lived in. They have a new building, regular rooms and deluxe, the old building is regular and junior and booked once with a junior suite, but was shocked by the old furniture and the air conditioning is hot, the maistahl are always booked in the old building, either the new building has new words, new rooms and new furniture and the hotel is close to metro and shana nana As for the…

93.review_text: A LOT OF ISSUES DURING THIS 7 NIGHT STAY.  We stayed at this hotel because of the positive reviews, but I am starting to think if these positive reviews came from real people who really stayed at this accommodation.   FIRST ISSUE:   The hotel is very hard to find on your own. We came from the BTS station and our phone’s GPS cannot really find the place.   SECOND ISSUE: The hotel is located in a red light district. Why we didn’t realize this prior to booking was our fault. But if you are a family with kids, do not stay at Nana!!!  If you are someone who wants peace and quiet , do not stay at NANA!   THIRD ISSUE: The hotel has two separate buildings and our room was in the second, newer building. This building has no gate or security and anyone can just access the elevators.  …

94.review_text: Good value for money, especially if you want to be close to Nana and are there for the nightlife.  Huge minus for safety reasons as we saw stairs/fire exit was completely blocked by pillows, mattresses etc. in the first floor (used as some sort of storage). Thus, blocking the only way out in case of fire. Simply not acceptable.

95.review_text: This hotel will appeal to travelers who prefer a quite hotel with spacious rooms.  The hotel is quite a distance to walk to the train station but we do not mind as the hotel provides a free shuttle service on demand up to midnight.  All employees are courteous, cheerful, attentive and helpful.    The price is very reasonable for a spacious room which includes buffet breakfast with a reasonable spread of food. the room is equipped with a small kitchenette with a microwave oven which will appeal to business travelers on extended stay. We will definitely stay at Alt Hotel when we visit Bangkok again.

96.review_text: I don’t know how we didn’t realize this is in a red light district. Sex workers coming in and out of the hotel. Nothing wrong with that, but I would prefer not to be in a hotel that’s primarily used for sex tourism. Questionable stains all over the beds. Disgusting. See attached photo.  Rooms are otherwise nice. If you’re here specifically to use for the sex tourism, then this is a suitable spot for you.

97.review_text: Alt nana hotel has two building ,the new one has a new furniture and a balcony.its faraway from the noisy bars and about ten minutes to nana mrt station.the hotel offer the guests with a shuttle electric car to drive you near the main street . The receptionist his name is king was helpful .He offer us an upgrade and quick check in  Recommended to stay in

98.review_text: Stayed here for 4 days , this hotel should be a 3 star rated. The room itself was all right but there was a constant air draft even when the aircon was switched off, so I ended up catching a cold. Bad thing is   Hotel is split up in 2 buildings and have a small pool area and a very small gym . Makes the place feel kind of boring. Lot of adult entertainment down the soi 4 road , place is pretty at night , but in daytime it's a place I don't like to be , very dirty and smells bad . Tuktuk drivers chasing you all the time , stay away from these hustlers, they want you no good in this part of the city. One night it knocked at my door , outside was a old Japanese guy standing completely drunk with a dwarf sized girl they was on the wrong floor I guess.  Pretty fun , but not a place…

99.review_text: Overall, a nice hotel with lovely staff. Staff were always very helpful and courteous. The rooms are only quite small and our room had only very small windows high up that you can’t see out of making the room very dark. The hotel is clean and had everything you needed for a short stay. Breakfast had a good variety of food, which slightly changed each day. The hotel is only a few minutes walk away from lots of bars.

100.review_text: This hotel is the best for it price. You don't have to pay to expensive to get good service. This one is superb! Upgraded my room, great breakfast, good service with their tuk2 to the main road. Quite swimming pool, comfy bed, friendly staff need to be highlighted! They let me swim when the pool supposed to be close at 10 pm.   Only 10 mins away to bts nana. It's not holiday if you don't want to walk right? 10 mins actually is nothing, but mostly you can get the shuttle tuktuk from the hotel.  Definitely will come back to this hotel if am in Bangkok again.
